channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: ‘Battle vs COVID not yet over’
item.description: As President Duterte has emphasized, the drive to contain the coronavirus disease 2019 outbreak in the country is not yet over, Sen. Bong Go said yesterday.

item.title: DOST OKs testing melatonin as COVID treatment
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: The government has allowed 260 patients from 24 hospitals in the country to participate in the World Health Organization solidarity trials as it pushed for cooperation in finding a vaccine and treatment for coronavirus disease 2019 here and abroad.

item.title: Online MSMEs ‘saviors of economy’
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Calling micro, small and medium enterprises that do business online “saviors of the economy in this time of the pandemic,” Albay Rep. Joey Salceda has appealed to the Bureau of Internal Revenue and the Department of Trade and Industry to exempt them from taxes and fees “for now” so they can thrive and spur overall economic development.

item.title: Lawmaker to PhilHealth: Settle P18 billion bill
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: State-owned Philippine Health Insurance Corp. (PhilHealth) has been urged to settle at least P18 billion in unpaid reimbursement claims of accredited hospitals nationwide.

item.title: 784 governors, mayors endorse anti-terror bill approval
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: A total of 784 local chief executives have expressed support for the anti-terror bill, Malacañang announced yesterday.

item.title: Duterte eyes transistor radios for students
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: To give children from far-flung areas access to proper education amid the pandemic, President Duterte wants to give them transistor radios so they will not be left out in the Department of Education plan to implement an alternative learning program by August.

item.title: House eyes P58 billion for tourism sector recovery
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: The House of Representatives is eyeing a P58-billion fund for recovery of the country’s tourism industry from recession caused by the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Hillary, Albright back Ressa on libel case
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Former US secretaries of state Hillary Clinton and Madeleine Albright yesterday expressed support for Rappler chief executive officer and executive editor Maria Ressa, who was convicted of cyber libel on Monday.

item.title: Duterte to tackle quarantine with business groups
item.author: Roel Pareño
item.description: President Duterte wants to meet with business groups to discuss possible adjustments to quarantine measures as well as ways to reopen the pandemic-battered economy.

item.title: PAL to offer ‘distancing seats’
item.author: Richmond Mercurio
item.description: Flag carrier Philippine Airlines will be offering “distancing seats” starting next month in a move to encourage more people to fly again despite the threat posed by the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.
